Introducing Aelios 2

November 1st, 2011 by The Jilion Team
Tweet

Aelios 2 is the first Weather App to support multiple weather providers by allowing its users to choose their preferred provider!

Alongside multi-provider support, we’re thrilled to offer data from AccuWeather – one of the world’s leading and most respected weather forecasters. We think our North american users will be particularly pleased!

With Aelios 1 we wanted to innovate in the Weather category by providing a completely new way to obtain weather forecasts. With version 2, Aelios’ unique user experience is decoupled from its data sources. We believe users should have the choice to use the weather data provider that serves them best!

We completely re-designed the info pane around our new multi-provider system, allowing users to arrange weather providers in order of preference.

We aim to bring more data providers in future updates. Please contact us if you have any suggestions of providers you’d like to see in Aelios.

We’re also working on some great new features for the near future, including a pretty useful (and slick) favorites system that should be available in a few weeks. Thank you for your patience, we know a lot of you are really looking forward to this feature and we’re sure you’ll love what we’ve come up with!

What’s New in Aelios 2

  • AccuWeather forecasts.
  • New multi-provider system lets you choose your providers in order of preference.
  • Quickly switch providers in weather poster view by swiping “forecast by…”
  • Redesigned info pane including News section.
  • Double-tap the map to zoom in without moving the center. Do this after you have located yourself or searched for a location to remain locked on.
  • Re-written architecture to improve performance, stability, animations and overall user experience.
  • New server infrastructure to handle multi-provider system.
  • Tips to help first-time users.
  • New start-up image featuring a map by famous cartographer Jodocus Hondius.

Aelios 2 is available now on the App Store.

Make sure to follow @jilion and @aeliosapp and keep an eye on the blog for the latest Aelios news. We hope you enjoy Aelios 2!

Leo Laporte loves Aelios Weather

July 8th, 2011 by The Jilion Team
Tweet

Aelios was just featured on Leo Laporte and Sarah Lane’s podcast “iPad Today 52: Weather App Extravaganza”! Check out the video (starting at 7:45).

There’s one funny thing about it that we really want to share with you:
You might have noticed that Leo always has a large LCD clock behind him. The truth is that this particular clock actually provided us with the spark of inspiration to design Aelios’ “Weather Poster” mode!

Indeed, during the design phase we routinely said to one another “We need to design a beautiful weather forecast view, something that could be used like Leo’s big clock; something that he would love himself”.

Last week this story came full circle; Leo and Sarah gave Aelios a rave review, all without ever speaking to us. Isn’t that cool ? :-)

The Team would like to give a warm thank you to Sarah and Leo for their kind words and this unintentional connection.

Aelios for iPad is available

Explore the World's Weather Forecasts!

May 23rd, 2011 by The Jilion Team
Tweet

Today we are launching Aelios Weather 1.0 for iPad, now available on the App Store at the special launch price of $2.99.

If you are reading through your RSS reader, please visit this web page on the browser to watch the video.

Aelios is a completely new kind of Weather app.

We have tried really hard to innovate in the weather category and we believe we have created something both functional and well designed; Something that your iPad really deserves.

Visit the Aelios’ website to learn more about the app and make sure you don’t miss the quick intro video.

Follow @aeliosapp and @jilion for the latest news on Aelios.

Tweet


Jilion is about to launch Aelios, our first iPad app!

Please visit Aelios’ teaser page and sign up to be notified when it becomes available on the App Store, which we plan to be later this month.

We believe that Aelios will redefine its category and we hope you will like it!
We won’t reveal much more just yet, but here’s a hint: it’s something you may want to use every day.

Follow @aeliosapp and @jilion for the latest news on Aelios.
